latex_learnings.summary: Learnings and best practices for rendering LaTeX in HTML.

principles.name: Use MathJax for Web Rendering
principles.rule: To render LaTeX in HTML, use the MathJax library. It can be included from a CDN in the <head> of the HTML file.

principles.name: Formula Delimiters
principles.rule: Wrap LaTeX formulas in '$' delimiters for inline math. This allows MathJax to identify and render them.

principles.name: Correct LaTeX Syntax
principles.rule: Use proper LaTeX syntax for mathematical expressions. For example, use ' rac{}{}' for fractions instead of the '/' character.

principles.name: Escaping in Scripts
principles.rule: When embedding MathJax configuration in a script (e.g., a Python f-string), be mindful of character escaping, especially for backslashes.
